pullRequest.title: DS-4486 Add support/tests for Collection/Community role-based groups for Community/Collection Admins
pullRequest.bodyText:
References
https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/DS-4486
Description
In this PR has been:

added another PreAuthorize check on EPersonRestRepository and GroupRestRepository search
methods to enable access to community and collection administrators as well
created some IT to proof that the commuity/collection admins have access to the search
methods
created some IT to proof that the commuity/collection admins can manage their own groups
(submitters, workflow, etc.)
restore IT to proof that the community/collection admins can create/delete their own groups

Checklist
This checklist provides a reminder of what we are going to look for when reviewing your PR. You need not complete this checklist prior to creating your PR (draft PRs are always welcome). If you are unsure about an item in the checklist, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help!

 My PR is small in size (e.g. less than 1,000 lines of code, not including comments & integration tests). Exceptions may be made if previously agreed upon.
 My PR passes Checkstyle validation based on the Code Style Guide
 My PR includes Javadoc for all new (or modified) public methods and classes. It also includes Javadoc for large or complex private methods.
 My PR passes all tests and includes new/updated Unit or Integration Tests for any bug fixes, improvements or new features. A few reminders about what constitutes good tests:

Include tests for different user types, including: (1) Anonymous user, (2) Logged in user (non-admin), and (3) Administrator.
Include tests for known error scenarios and error codes (e.g. 400 Bad Request, 401 Unauthorized, 403 Forbidden, 404 Not Found, etc)
For bug fixes, include a test that reproduces the bug and proves it is fixed. For clarity, it may be useful to provide the test in a separate commit from the bug fix.


N/A If my PR includes new, third-party dependencies (in any pom.xml), I've made sure their licenses align with the DSpace BSD License based on the Licensing of Contributions documentation.
N/A If my PR modifies the REST API, I've linked to the REST Contract page (or open PR) related to this change.

commit.message: added implementations for support for Collection/Community role-based groups for Community/Collection Admins
added ITs for search method byMetadata by community admin and by collection admin
added ITs to prove that admins of community/collection can manage submitters
added ITs to prove that admins of community/collection can manage their own groups

nodes.bodyText:
This if is in another if that checks the following:
               if (AuthorizeConfiguration.canCollectionAdminManageWorkflows() || AuthorizeConfiguration.canCommunityAdminManageCollectionWorkflows()) {
Should that if not be expanded to include this one ?
Should it also not a include a check on AuthorizeConfiguration.canCommunityAdminManagePolicies() ?
Small typo in the variable name, should be "isCollectionAdmin"
Can we rename this constant ? ACCOUNT_ADMIN_GRANT doesn't really point to the fact that the user could be a community / collection admin.
Tiny thing, this method should have an @Override
Again, this method should have an @Override

I'm not sure about the name here too. The name "ACCOUNT_ADMIN" sounds like this role is for administration of all accounts in DSpace, so I'd expect that role to be able to add/delete/update all EPerson objects (which isn't the case here).
This role is more about managing the access permissions/groups of a Community/Collection, which only involves having delete rights on those specific groups, while having read permissions on all other Groups/EPeople.
So, I wonder if we should rename this to be something like MANAGE_ACCESS_GROUPS or MANAGE_COMCOL_GROUPS or similar.  That'd make it clearer that this is less about ADMIN rights, and more about management of group memberships.

You don't need these two context lines here. You can change a configuration property in tests without turning off the authorization system.  Also, the configuration system resets itself after every test, so you may be able to remove all three lines here...you need not reset it back to the default value.
Again, no need to turn off/on authorization here.
These 3 lines can be removed, no need to reset it to the default value, it'll do that automatically after the test runs.
Same here, can remove these 3 lines. It'll reset automatically.
No need to turn off authorization to change a config value. remove context lines
These 3 lines can be removed
These 4 lines can be removed. configs will reset to defaults automatically.
These 4 lines can be removed. Configs reset automatically.
No need to turn off authorization to set configs
These 4 lines can be removed. Configs reset automatically.
These 4 lines can be removed. Configs reset automatically.
No need to turn on/off authorization to set configs
No need to reset these values. These 4 lines can be removed
No need to turn off/on authorization to set configs. The context lines here can be removed
Again, these 4 lines can be removed
Same here, these 4 lines can be removed
No need to turn on/off authorization to set configs.
